alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Cleveland and northwestern McClain Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1030 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oklahoma City to near Norman. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Newcastle, Noble, Slaughterville, Goldsby, Lake Thunderbird, and Little Axe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 106 and 120. Interstate 44 between mile markers 105 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
